intro: Scabiosa comosa f. albiflora, commonly known as the white scabious, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is characterized by its fluffy, white blooms that resemble small clouds, giving it a delicate and ethereal appearance. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are primarily pollinated by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological value. The foliage is usually gray-green with hairy surfaces, adding to its distinctive botanical features.
